triples.name: Interpersonal ties
triples.relevance: The paper tests the strength of weak ties, a foundational concept in understanding how weak interpersonal connections facilitate job mobility.

triples.name: LinkedIn
triples.relevance: LinkedIn provides the empirical platform and data for the large-scale randomized experiments examining over 20 million users.

triples.name: Labor mobility
triples.relevance: Job mobility is the occupational movement of workers that the paper measures as the outcome variable in testing the strength of weak ties.

triples.name: Social network
triples.relevance: Social networks form the theoretical framework through which the paper analyzes connections between individuals and job transmission.

triples.name: Randomized experiment
triples.relevance: The paper employs large-scale randomized experiments on LinkedIn to provide causal evidence about the strength of weak ties.

triples.name: Inverted U-shaped relationship
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and discovers an inverted U-shaped (nonlinear) relationship between tie strength and job transmission, refining the original strength of weak ties theory.
